static double [][] edu.ou.asgbook.filters.ConvolutionFilter.boxcar ( int  numx,
int  numy 
) [static] 

00104                                                        {
00105         double[][] coeffs = new double[numx][numy];
00106         
00107         double tot = numx * numy;
00108         for (int i=0; i < coeffs.length; ++i){
00109             for (int j=0; j < coeffs.length; ++j){
00110                 coeffs[i][j] = 1 / tot;
00111             }
00112         }
00113         
00114         return coeffs;
00115     }

LatLonGrid edu.ou.asgbook.filters.ConvolutionFilter.convolve ( final LatLonGrid  input  ) 

Uses the coefficients and returns the convolved value without dividing by sum of weights Use this for non-smoothing coefficients. 

00077                                                       {
00078         LatLonGrid output = LatLonGrid.copyOf(input);
00079         output.fill(output.getMissing());
00080         int[][] outData = output.getData();
00081         int[][] inData = input.getData();
00082         final int hx = coeffs.length / 2;
00083         final int hy = coeffs[0].length / 2;
00084         final int nx = output.getNumLat();
00085         final int ny = output.getNumLon();
00086         for (int i=hx; i < (nx-hx); ++i){
00087             for (int j=hy; j < (ny-hy); ++j){
00088                 double tot = 0;
00089                 for (int m=-hx; m <= hx; ++m){
00090                     for (int n=-hy; n <= hy; ++n){
00091                         double coeff = coeffs[m+hx][n+hy];
00092                         int inval = inData[i+m][j+n];
00093                         if (inval != input.getMissing()){
00094                             tot += inval*coeff;
00095                         }
00096                     }
00097                 }
00098                 outData[i][j] = (int) Math.round(tot);
00099             }
00100         }
00101         return output;
00102     }

static double [][] edu.ou.asgbook.filters.ConvolutionFilter.gauss ( int  numx,
int  numy,
double  sigmax,
double  sigmay 
) [static] 

00121                                                                                     {
00122         double[][] coeffs = new double[numx][numy];
00123         
00124         for (int i=0; i < coeffs.length; ++i){
00125             for (int j=0; j < coeffs.length; ++j){
00126                 double x = (i - coeffs.length/2.0)/sigmax;
00127                 double y = (j - coeffs[0].length/2.0)/sigmay;
00128                 coeffs[i][j] = Math.exp(-(x*x + y*y));
00129             }
00130         }
00131         
00132         return coeffs;
00133     }

00117                                                       {

00119     }

static void edu.ou.asgbook.filters.ConvolutionFilter.main ( String[]  args  )  throws Exception [static] 

00135                                                             {
00136         // create output directory
00137         File out = OutputDirectory.getDefault("convolve");
00138         
00139         // read input
00140         LatLonGrid popdensity = GlobalPopulation.read(GlobalPopulation.NORTHAMERICA, new GlobalPopulation.LogScaling()).crop(900, 2500, 200, 200);
00141         KmlWriter.write(popdensity, out, "orig", PngWriter.createCoolToWarmColormap());
00142         
00143         // average
00144         {
00145             ConvolutionFilter filter = new ConvolutionFilter(ConvolutionFilter.boxcar(3, 3));
00146             LatLonGrid sm = filter.smooth(popdensity);
00147             KmlWriter.write(sm, out, "boxcar1", PngWriter.createCoolToWarmColormap());
00148         }
00149         
00150         // boxcar
00151         {
00152             ConvolutionFilter filter = new ConvolutionFilter(ConvolutionFilter.boxcar(5, 5));
00153             LatLonGrid sm = filter.smooth(popdensity);
00154             KmlWriter.write(sm, out, "boxcar", PngWriter.createCoolToWarmColormap());
00155         }
00156         
00157         // gauss
00158         {
00159             ConvolutionFilter filter = new ConvolutionFilter(ConvolutionFilter.gauss(11, 11));
00160             LatLonGrid sm = filter.smooth(popdensity);
00161             KmlWriter.write(sm, out, "gauss", PngWriter.createCoolToWarmColormap());
00162         }
00163     }

LatLonGrid edu.ou.asgbook.filters.ConvolutionFilter.smooth ( final LatLonGrid  input  ) 

Uses weights, but only at non-missing pixels, and divides by the total weight.

Use this for smoothing 

00042                                                     {
00043         LatLonGrid output = LatLonGrid.copyOf(input);
00044         output.fill(output.getMissing());
00045         int[][] outData = output.getData();
00046         int[][] inData = input.getData();
00047         final int hx = coeffs.length / 2;
00048         final int hy = coeffs[0].length / 2;
00049         final int nx = output.getNumLat();
00050         final int ny = output.getNumLon();
00051         for (int i=hx; i < (nx-hx); ++i){
00052             for (int j=hy; j < (ny-hy); ++j){
00053                 double tot = 0;
00054                 double wt = 0;
00055                 for (int m=-hx; m <= hx; ++m){
00056                     for (int n=-hy; n <= hy; ++n){
00057                         double coeff = coeffs[m+hx][n+hy];
00058                         int inval = inData[i+m][j+n];
00059                         if (inval != input.getMissing()){
00060                             tot += inval*coeff;
00061                             wt += coeff;
00062                         }
00063                     }
00064                 }
00065                 if ( wt > 0 ){
00066                     outData[i][j] = (int)( Math.round(tot / wt) );
00067                 }
00068             }
00069         }
00070         return output;
00071     }
